results.title: The Onedin line. Series 2. Part 2
results.brief_description: For the sake of profit, James and Albert Fraser secretly aid a fever ship into Liverpool, however with Daniel Fogarty aiding the public inquiry into the death of local sailors from Yellow Fever, their discovery seems imminent. When the Charlotte Rhodes is quarantined during the middle of a lucrative trip, James suffers significant financial loss and discovers that his estranged wife of one month, Anne, has been taken ill. Albert becomes involved with Carrie Harris, a singer at Fox’s Music Rooms, when Elizabeth pays scant affection towards his advances. The affair proves to be more trouble than its worth, despite providing Albert with some comfort. Meanwhile, James finds that he has stirred up trouble amongst the superstitious crew when they retrieve a shipwrecked sailor on return from China.

results.title: The Onedin line. Series 2. Part 1
results.brief_description: Despite losing a ship on the Cape, James Onedin is in an optimistic mood as the American Civil War has ended, and with it are new opportunities for shipping trade. For James to profit however, he needs to add a modern steamship to the line, and gain control of the company. The only thing that stands in his way is Daniel Fogarty. Callon’s young niece, Emma, suddenly becomes a new principal share holder to the Onedin Line with the sudden death of Albert Callon and his son in a warehouse fire. Emma places her trust in Fogarty as James sails for the West Indies. Daniel, now elected company chairman, announces his engagement to Emma. Meanwhile, Anne is frustrated by James’s apparent harshness to the men, and puts charity before loyalty to her husband. As a result of striking workers, James gives Anne an ultimatum that forces her to leave.

results.title: The Onedin Line. Part 4
results.brief_description: Master William, son of Elisabeth is now 12 months old. Albert has learned the disheartening truth that Daniel is the father. Outraged he decides to take up an offer of building steamships in America. Small pox is contracted by Master William, as well as some of the passengers of the “Charlotte Rhodes”; will they go into quarantine? The American Civil War means the people there are desperately in need of supplies. Will James make it through the blackade to deliver them? Mr. Baines has been made Captain, and Robert and James make the Onedin Line a public share holding company. The age of steam ships is fast approaching. Should the Onedin Line resist its lure or invest everything? After all, if successful, it could offer James the opportunity to defeat his arch enemy Callon once and for all…

results.title: The Onedin Line. Part 3
results.brief_description: Callon is forcing Robert to sell his shop. One of James’ ships explodes and the insurance is deemed invalid. In desperation a shady deal is hatched to regain losses. A mysterious well-paying passenger is aboard the “Charlotte Rhodes” for safe passage home, but Baines and his trusty crew are not sailing this journey. More problems on the horizon, with one of James’ ships in a state of mutiny. Daniel Fogarty arrives home to find his Elisabeth wed to Albert Fraser and pregnant with his baby.

results.title: The Onedin Line. Part 2
results.brief_description: While on a voyage Daniel Fogarty is promoted to Captain; Elisabeth is pregnant but still unsure of who she wants to marry. James’ first mate - trustworthy Baines - is kidnapped by Americans. The “Charlotte Rhodes” is also in trouble, doomed to be lost by sinking and it is not insured. With Fraser’s first trial steamboat, James and Robert race against Callon to salvage the “Charlotte Rhodes”. James and his wine merchant strike a deal to import 100,000 vines from America, to James’ advantage. An old beau of Anne’s returns to Liverpool to find her situation much changed.

results.title: The Onedin Line. Part 1
results.brief_description: The year is 1860 in Liverpool in England, Captain James Onedin is tired of working for shrewd ship owner Mr. Callon. A ship for auction the ‘Charlotte Rhodes” owned by a determined woman Anne Webster, gives James the chance of ownership. An unusual contract is made ; with Robert (James’ brother) - and the Onedin Line is begun. However owning a ship and finding trade is not as easy as it would seem. James’ sister Elisabeth has two men competing for her attention - wealthy ship son Albert Fraser and seaman Daniel Fogarty - she must decide soon.

results.title: The One that got away
results.creator_credit: Rank Organisation Film Productions, Julian Wintle and Roy Baker
results.brief_description: This is the dramatic true story of the only German prisoner of war taken in Britain who escaped from captivity and successfully returned to Germany; Luftwaffe pilot Lieutenant Franz Von Werra (Hardy Kruger). Von Werra was captured during the Battle of Britain when his Messerschmitt was shot down in the English countryside. The film is significant in that it was made during the period after World War 2 when the majority of British films paid homage to the heroism of British troops. Von Werra’s meticulous and determined bid for freedom took him across England, Canada, the United States, until he finally reached home. Screenplay by Howard Clewes from the book by Kendal Burt and James Leasor. Cast includes Hardy Kruger, Colin Gordon, Michael Goodliffe and Terence Alexander.

results.title: The One that got away
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Robin Hughes and Gillian Coote
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Working series”.
One of a series of films about attitudes to work. School teacher, Lowell decided to give up teaching, get away from the hassles of living and working in the city and become a fisherman. He and his family enjoy living in the peaceful bush in a cottage with few modern amenities. His parents on the other hand cannot understand his attitude. Photographed by Paul Tait, edited by Lana Bennett, sound by Rowland McManus.

results.title: The Omen
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Harvey Bernhard and Richard Donner
results.brief_description: In a moment of grief American Diplomat Robert Thorn (Gregory Peck) swaps his stillborn son with a newly born orphan, unbeknownst to his wife, Katherine (Lee Remick). What they both don’t know however is that the child was born at 6am, on the 6th day, of the 6th month (666), fulfilling a prophecy in the Bible that the coming of Armageddon will begin with the birth of Satan’s son. As their son, Damien (Harvey Stephens), grows older, it becomes apparent that this is no ordinary child. Sure enough, evil nannies, vicious dobermans and tormented priests begin to plague the family, while mysterious and gruesome deaths occur around the boy. This popular film spawned two sequels (“Damien: Omen 2” and “The Final conflict”). This 25th anniversary edition contains a documentary on the making of the film called “666: The Omen revealed”, a feature called “Curse or coincidence” about the mysterious incidents surrounding its production, interview clips and the original theatrical trailer. Cast also includes David Warner, Billie Whitelaw and Holly Palance.

results.title: The Omega man
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Walter Seltzer and Boris Sagal
results.brief_description: Welcome to the future where humankind has been decimated due to the effects of biological warfare. Robert Neville, played by Charlton Heston, roams the windy, ghostly streets of Los Angeles, searching for supplies. At sundown, other “survivors” emerge; the blood-thirsty “Family”, neopeople who are not quite human. Rosalind Cash stars as the caretaker of a small but healthy band of children who represent the future of our species. Together, she and Heston, must keep them from “The Family’s” grasp. Based on Richard Matheson’s classic sci-fi novel “I am a legend”.
